title: PLAZA / RENE TURNING BACK TIME
description: Ask René if he knows a way to turn back time

dialogueTree.title: You: ""René... I need to go back in time...."
dialogueTree.text: "René... I need to go back in time. Can you help me?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant flashes you a quick..."
links.text: The lieutenant flashes you a quick side-glance.

links.title: Composure: "His posture tenses."
links.text: His posture tenses.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Damn it, not this again..."
links.text: Damn it, not this again...

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "What are you up to now?"
links.text: What are you up to now?

links.title: René Arnoux: ""What?!" The old soldier scowls at..."
links.text: "What?!" The old soldier scowls at you, unamused.

links.title: Empathy: "He thinks you're playing a joke on..."
links.text: He thinks you're playing a joke on him.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Now, now..." His partner raises bo..."
links.text: "Now, now..." His partner raises both hands in a calming gesture. "I'm sure the officer means it figuratively. Like a forensic technique or something, right?"

links.title: You: ""No, I need to go back to a time wh..."
links.text: "No, I need to go back to a time when *love* was still possible."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""*Bon sang*, son. You must have a l..."
links.text: "*Bon sang*, son. You must have a loose screw up there or something." He taps on his temple. "Sounds like you really mean it."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Alright, I will entertain this......"
links.text: "Alright, I will entertain this... *fantasy*, if you tell me, what interest does an RCM officer have in... 'time travel'?"

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh, you're in for a treat, officer..."
links.text: "Oh, you're in for a treat, officer. Seeing the playful side of old René is about as rare as a red rainbow."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Not actually *that* rare. It's just..."
links.text: Not actually *that* rare. It's just that red, or monochrome, rainbows usually occur at sunrise or sunset, when blue and green wavelengths are scattered before reaching water droplets. Fewer eyes to see them then.

links.title: You: ""Love. It's about love.""
links.text: "Love. It's about love."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""It's always about love, isn't it?""
links.text: "It's always about love, isn't it?"

links.title: Reaction Speed: "Was that a smile on his wrinkled......"
links.text: Was that a smile on his wrinkled... nevermind, it's gone.

links.title: René Arnoux: ""But it's never *only* about love,..."
links.text: "But it's never *only* about love, so what else, officer?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant rubs his forehead an..."
links.text: The lieutenant rubs his forehead and mumbles something under his breath.

links.title: Reaction Speed: "'Here we go again.'"
links.text: 'Here we go again.'

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes." The lieutenant turns to look..."
links.text: "Yes." The lieutenant turns to look at you as well. "What else, officer?"

links.title: You: ""Men have lost their way. I want to..."
links.text: "Men have lost their way. I want to guide them back. Like a beacon."

links.title: René Arnoux: "The old soldier nods. "Even after t..."
links.text: The old soldier nods. "Even after the Revolution, after the Beachhead, there was a chance. Had we just stayed true to our *values*..."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""It happened slowly, like a seedlin..."
links.text: "It happened slowly, like a seedling growing into a tree. Tiny incremental steps. Imperceptible till the thicket was so thick you couldn't clear it with a flamethrower..."

links.title: Half Light: "You could *definitely* clear it wit..."
links.text: You could *definitely* clear it with a flamethrower.

links.title: You: ""Well, that depends on the flamethr..."
links.text: "Well, that depends on the flamethrower..."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""It really does, doesn't it?" The o..."
links.text: "It really does, doesn't it?" The old soldier produces a strange croaking sound -- with laughter-like qualities -- then quickly massages his chest. "But honestly, why?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "Keep the war-crime jokes coming and..."
links.text: Keep the war-crime jokes coming and you'll end up on his good side.

links.title: You: ""I *know* I can get history back on..."
links.text: "I *know* I can get history back on the right track."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""The 'right track'? This *is* the r..."
links.text: "The 'right track'? This *is* the right track! The only track." He gets visibly annoyed. "This is the world we shaped, a reflection of what we are: cowardly, ugly, and numb."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""And there are no second chances. W..."
links.text: "And there are no second chances. We don't deserve them! You can't just go back and restart -- that would make everything *MEANINGLESS*!" A shadow of pain comes over his face.

links.title: Empathy: "There's something *substantial* mov..."
links.text: There's something *substantial* moving in him, trying to get out.

links.title: Volition: "He would sooner die than let it sur..."
links.text: He would sooner die than let it surface.

links.title: You: "What is it?"
links.text: What is it?

links.title: Empathy: "Regret."
links.text: Regret.

links.title: You: "Regret about what?"
links.text: Regret about what?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Him."
links.text: Him.

links.title: You: ""Him?""
links.text: "Him?"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "There's tenderness in the carabinee..."
links.text: There's tenderness in the carabineer's look. Tenderness that's curdled into pain or something darker.

links.title: You: "Ex-love, ex-tenderness..."
links.text: Ex-love, ex-tenderness...

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Even worse, a love aborted and smot..."
links.text: Even worse, a love aborted and smothered, stamped beneath his brilliant boot heel.

links.title: René Arnoux: "You catch the old carabineer's gaze..."
links.text: You catch the old carabineer's gaze slowly leaving his opponent's wrinkled face as his dark eyes meet yours -- whatever turmoil raged in him a moment ago is quelled for now.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Like the last rays of the evening s..."
links.text: Like the last rays of the evening sun gently kissing the day goodbye, before giving way to unfathomable darkness.

links.title: Volition: "Willed back into the darkest unexpl..."
links.text: Willed back into the darkest unexplored depths of his mind -- never meant to be shared, seen or confronted.

links.title: Composure: "A true master of his emotions."
links.text: A true master of his emotions.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Hopelessly alone behind the unbreak..."
links.text: Hopelessly alone behind the unbreakable walls he spent a lifetime erecting. No one will ever know him.

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Our lives are unique, and I have n..."
links.text: "Our lives are unique, and I have neither the means nor the will to help you change that." A polite nod. "But I will gladly assist you with police matters."

links.title: You: ""Who?""
links.text: "Who?"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You know the answer, don't think --..."
links.text: You know the answer, don't think -- just say it!

links.title: You: ""Gun!""
links.text: "Gun!"

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Where?!" His head drops between hi..."
links.text: "Where?!" His head drops between his shoulders he snaps around with surprising speed.

links.title: Savoir Faire: "Retired or not, there's still a tra..."
links.text: Retired or not, there's still a trained killer in there.

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Goddamnit, son..." He turns back t..."
links.text: "Goddamnit, son..." He turns back to you, frowning. "As an officer of the law you should know better than... damn it! Are we done here?"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "No... not gun. Something repressed..."
links.text: No... not gun. Something repressed and painful. Too late. The moment has passed.

links.title: You: ""Kim?""
links.text: "Kim?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*Meaningless* is what I think this..."
links.text: "*Meaningless* is what I think this line of questioning is. Call me a sceptic, but I don't think time travel is going to solve our murder case."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So... Is there anything else you w..."
links.text: "So... Is there anything else you want from these gentlemen, or can we get back to it?"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "Shouldn't have brought him into thi..."
links.text: Shouldn't have brought him into this. He doesn't know pain like you do.

links.title: You: ""War.""
links.text: "War."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""W-war?" The word seems to derail h..."
links.text: "W-war?" The word seems to derail his train of thought. "I mean yes. Yes... It changes men, changes lives and uh..."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""What the hell are we talking about..."
links.text: "What the hell are we talking about here, officer?" He rubs the back of his head. "Look, we just want to play our game, so unless there's something else..."

links.title: Pain Threshold: "War isn't tied with regret for him...."
links.text: War isn't tied with regret for him. Nevermind, the moment is gone.

links.title: You: ""Dad?!""
links.text: "Dad?!"

links.title: Pain Threshold: "No, not that one."
links.text: No, not that one.

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Wh...? Oh, I see." He takes a step..."
links.text: "Wh...? Oh, I see." He takes a step back and nods, jaw clenched tight. "You're a comedian after all. Funny guy. *Unpredictable*."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Alright, you got your laugh, ruine..."
links.text: "Alright, you got your laugh, ruined my concentration and our game... Anything else you want, or can we start a new one?"

links.title: You: ""I'm not gonna say anything.""
links.text: "I'm not gonna say anything."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""That's just *typical*!" The carabi..."
links.text: "That's just *typical*!" The carabineer looks at you with disgust. "All you young guys these days. You want to be opinionated, controversial, opposition leaders..."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""But as soon as the talk turns real..."
links.text: "But as soon as the talk turns real and there's a smallest amount of friction you're suddenly 'not gonna say anything'. Better to be wrong than a goddamn coward!"

links.title: You: ""No, I didn't mean it like that.""
links.text: "No, I didn't mean it like that."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Oh save it." He waves you off. "Me..."
links.text: "Oh save it." He waves you off. "Men don't have substance anymore, I know that, but seeing such spinelessness in a man bearing an insignia..."

links.title: Volition: "You know what you meant, but taking..."
links.text: You know what you meant, but taking this kind of scolding does *not* feel good.

links.title: You: ""Did I say that out loud?""
links.text: "Did I say that out loud?"

links.title: You: "No, this is going too far. I should..."
links.text: No, this is going too far. I should respect his privacy!

links.title: You: "Even thinking about it is invading..."
links.text: Even thinking about it is invading his privacy. Better let it go.

links.title: Empathy: "Honour walks and virtue follows. Yo..."
links.text: Honour walks and virtue follows. You are truly a Detective-Saint, for you refuse to veer even when *no one* is looking. Bravo!

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Easy, René, take it easy." There's..."
links.text: "Easy, René, take it easy." There's genuine concern in his face. "You're right, absolutely right. What was, *was* and that's it. Isn't that right, officer?"

links.title: Composure: "His eyes seem to be pleading with y..."
links.text: His eyes seem to be pleading with you.

links.title: You: ""Sure, why not?""
links.text: "Sure, why not?"

links.title: René Arnoux: ""*Imbécile, un putain d'imbécile*....."
links.text: "*Imbécile, un putain d'imbécile*..." The old veteran clutches his chest and tries to steady his breathing.

links.title: Empathy: "*Something* about this topic was ve..."
links.text: *Something* about this topic was very personal to him, but the moment has passed.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""You must forgive mean old René, of..."
links.text: "You must forgive mean old René, officer!" The other one jumps in. "He can't stop being himself more than a scorpion can stop being a sco..."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Enough yacking!" the carabineer cu..."
links.text: "Enough yacking!" the carabineer cuts Gaston off mid-sentence. "We have a game to finish, so let's get back to it, unless there's something else?"

links.title: Endurance: "The carabineer is too old and feebl..."
links.text: The carabineer is too old and feeble to be useful. But you will carry on. *Movere tempore*, kingsman. For the tenacious no road is impassable.

links.title: René Arnoux: "The old carabineer looks at you wit..."
links.text: The old carabineer looks at you with wary expectation.

links.title: You: ""*Everyone* deserves a second chanc..."
links.text: "*Everyone* deserves a second chance."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""*Imbécile, un putain d'imbécile!*...."
links.text: "*Imbécile, un putain d'imbécile!*..." The old veteran clutches his chest and tries to steady his breathing.

links.title: Empathy: "*Something* about this topic was ve..."
links.text: *Something* about this topic was very personal to him, but the moment has passed.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Enough, officer," the other one sa..."
links.text: "Enough, officer," the other one says with surprising resoluteness. "We can't help you. Not with this. Such an *emotional* topic..."

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""But don't worry, I'm sure there's..."
links.text: "But don't worry, I'm sure there's something else old René or I can assist you with."

links.title: You: ""Look, I just want to turn back tim..."
links.text: "Look, I just want to turn back time. Can either of you help me or not?"

links.title: René Arnoux: ""*Imbécile, un putain d'imbécile*....."
links.text: "*Imbécile, un putain d'imbécile*..." The old veteran clutches his chest and tries to steady his breathing.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""No, officer." He shakes his head m..."
links.text: "No, officer." He shakes his head meekly. "We can't help you with that, maybe there's something else we *can* help you with?"

links.title: Endurance: "The carabineer is too old and feebl..."
links.text: The carabineer is too old and feeble to be useful. But you will carry on. *Movere tempore*, kingsman. For the tenacious no road is impassable.

links.title: You: ""I just want a second chance. Gonna..."
links.text: "I just want a second chance. Gonna do it right this time."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""'This time'?!" He's becoming visib..."
links.text: "'This time'?!" He's becoming visibly annoyed. "What happened to the first time? Did you make a mistake? Did you *fuck up*? Everyone did!"

links.title: You: ""I'm not sure, to be honest. Just g..."
links.text: "I'm not sure, to be honest. Just going with the flow."

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Exactly what history needs." He sp..."
links.text: "Exactly what history needs." He spits on the ground between the two of you. "More drifters, confused wanderers, weightless men..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There's so much bitterness in his v..."
links.text: There's so much bitterness in his voice it barely even registers as sarcasm.

links.title: René Arnoux: ""I can't help you officer," he says..."
links.text: "I can't help you officer," he says coldly. "There are no second chances in life. We don't deserve them. This is the world we shaped -- a reflection of what we are. Wasted, ugly, and numb."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant clears his throat. "..."
links.text: The lieutenant clears his throat. "I think we're done here unless you have questions *not* relating to 'time travel' for the gentlemen?"

links.title: Endurance: "Don't worry, he doesn't know anythi..."
links.text: Don't worry, he doesn't know anything useful, the man's almost expired. No fire in him. But *you* will carry on the flame. *Semper fidelis*, kingsman, anything is possible.

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Anything else you want or can we g..."
links.text: "Anything else you want or can we get back to our game?"

links.title: You: ""It *is* an ugly world...""
links.text: "It *is* an ugly world..."

links.title: Gaston Martin: "A heavy silence falls over the crat..."
links.text: A heavy silence falls over the crater. The man in the checkered suit doesn't know where to look or what to do with his hands. Finally he speaks:

links.title: Empathy: "Only to break the silence."
links.text: Only to break the silence.

links.title: Gaston Martin: ""Officer, you must forgive Old René..."
links.text: "Officer, you must forgive Old René. Holding a conversation has always been... problematic with him." He flashes you a quick smile. "Try asking him something else."

links.title: You: ""You know, it's not actually that b..."
links.text: "You know, it's not actually that bad."

links.title: You: "Just nod."
links.text: Just nod.

links.title: You: ""Such a downer, I'm not even sure h..."
links.text: "Such a downer, I'm not even sure how to respond..."

links.title: You: ""No, I literally need to go back in..."
links.text: "No, I literally need to go back in time. For Revachol."

links.title: You: ""Right, right... A forensic techniq..."
links.text: "Right, right... A forensic technique. Can you help me or not?"

links.title: René Arnoux: ""Forensic techniques are your forte..."
links.text: "Forensic techniques are your forte, not mine, officer." Something stiffens in the man. He shakes his head. "Find another fool, I will not be part of your... joke."

links.title: You: ""Forget it. Let's move on." (Drop i..."
links.text: "Forget it. Let's move on." (Drop it.)

links.title: René Arnoux: ""I thought you were a busy man, off..."
links.text: "I thought you were a busy man, officer. Or at least you should be, so I won't comment on this... eccentricity. Now what?"

links.title: Endurance: "He doesn't know anything, he's too..."
links.text: He doesn't know anything, he's too old. Doesn't have that *fire* in him anymore. But no worries, *we* will carry on. *Semper fidelis*, kingsman!
